document_data.caption: ''The wizard Mhair Gulzrabban''
document_data.name: Mhair Gulzrabban
document_data.aliases: Lord Irthas of the Thorncrown Empire
document_data.text: ''"Fair our meeting; let Faerûn be made fairer still because of it."''
document_data.mainbody: As time passed, he faced mutiny and dissatisfaction within his company until deciding to stalk fellow adventurers.
document_data.Description: Mhair was a stout small man with tiny dark eyes.
document_data.Personality: The [[wizard]] was always in control, seeking power above all else and wanting to do as he pleased. He was always on the lookout for new ways to exploit a weakness or two in order to gain a profit.
document_data.Abilities: Mhair, along with all of the other members of the Company of the Cloak, possessed an immunity to [[oil of taggit]] (which causes unconsciousness).
document_data.Relationships: [[Sharaera Duthtue]] was Mhair's lover and apprentice. He was prepared for her eventual turn on him. Over the years, Gulzrabban made contacts with the [[Zhentarim]], the [[Red Wizards of Thay]], and the [[Shadow Thieves]] and set his organization up as "adventurer killers".
document_data.History:
Gulzrabban began the Company of the Cloak in [[1357 DR]] in the city of [[Scornubel]] within the [[Western Heartlands]]. Recruiting cutthroats and brigands, Mhair assembled a band to hunt down buried treasure and forgotten lore. 
{{fq
| float  = right
| source = [[Ed Greenwood]], ''[[Power of Faerûn]]''

As time passed, he faced mutiny and dissatisfaction within his company until deciding to stalk fellow adventurers.
